metadata.title: CVE-2018-16948 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenAFS before 1.6.23 and 1.8.x before 1.8.2.Several RPC server routines did not fully initialize their output variablesbefore returning, leaking memory contents from both the stack and the heap.Because the OpenAFS cache manager functions as an Rx server for the AFSCBservice, clients are also susceptible to information leakage. For example,RXAFSCB_TellMeAboutYourself leaks kernel memory and KAM_ListEntry leakskaserver memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16948` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libafsauthent2 - 1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2
libafsrpc2 - 1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2
libkopenafs2 - 1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2
openafs-client - 1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2
openafs-dbserver - 1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2
openafs-fileserver - 1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2
openafs-fuse - 1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2
openafs-krb5 - 1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2
openafs-modules-dkms - 1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2
openafs-modules-source - 1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openafs package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.4~pre1-1ubuntu2').
